summary: This document is an email chain from December 18, 2019, forwarding a tip from the National Human Trafficking Hotline (Polaris) to the FBI. The tip alleges potential recruitment of females for sex trafficking associated with Jeffrey Epstein, involving an adult female who worked for Epstein and claimed knowledge of victims being recruited from NYC dance studios to go to his private island.

keyFacts: A tip was forwarded from Polaris to the FBI on December 18, 2019, alleging ongoing potential recruitment for sex trafficking linked to Jeffrey Epstein.
The tip involves an adult female, approximately 40 years old, who allegedly worked as a recruiter for Epstein 10 years prior.
The recruitment method allegedly involved targeting 'mature and responsible' potential victims from unspecified dance studios in New York City to be taken to Epstein's private island.
The tipster claimed the recruiter knew potential victims were being sexually assaulted and that the recruiter's name appears on flight records to and from the private island.
The document highlights post-arrest and post-death allegations of continued trafficking activity associated with Epstein's network.
